Star League flag from battletech?

I got the flag made, what color do you want the background? Here is a few examples so far...
Retool this flag?

Retool this flag?

http://i.imgur.com/dTorN18.jpg

How so? Just a re-design of what's there?

How so? Just a re-design of what's there?

Yes. I tried my hand at flag making. Turns out I'm not so great at it.

Yes. I tried my hand at flag making. Turns out I'm not so great at it.

Honestly it doesn't look too bad. I can do some minor upgrades for ya, no problem.

I've spent the past couple of days mulling over a redesign of my flag but I can't seem to get it right so I was hoping I could request some assistance

This is my old flag, I like the minimalist design and how it sort of rips off the ESA

These are my current stabs at a new flag, I like the colors and star but it seems too roman and not enough space

thanks

Edited September 29, 2015 by Outback_Zach

Wow! Great work! I would probably go with the white background, but they're all good. Thank you very much.

Do one for the Freelance Community of Unaligned Kerbals.

JR

Edit: Sorry I didn't realize you wanted no text...

We could write it out in "Kerbalese" (Webding/ Wingdings, idk...) on a banner. Sort of like a crest? I could tinker with the idea tomorrow.

I kind of like the Roman feel. What if you took the symbol from you first flag and super impose it on top of that star? I bet that would look good, and not so ancient. If you still can't get it the way you want it let us know, I'm sure one of the designers here will be available. :)

Hmm... How about a Cyan and white flag, with 3 cyan hollow hexagons arranged kind of in a triangle, surrounded by a cyan ring, with a cyan stripe form one end of the rig t the other, but not in the middle. Offset the hexagon and ring structure about 1/3 of the way from the left, and make everything else white, and it'll be fine. Basically this: http://imgur.com/8sGT3Mb

but better, and with thicker lines

Hmm... How about a Cyan and white flag, with 3 cyan hollow hexagons arranged kind of in a triangle, surrounded by a cyan ring, with a cyan stripe form one end of the rig t the other, but not in the middle. Offset the hexagon and ring structure about 1/3 of the way from the left, and make everything else white, and it'll be fine. Basically this: http://imgur.com/8sGT3Mb

but better, and with thicker lines

That will turn out awesome I think.

Can you doge cat-ify this? I'm not at school so I have to use Google Drive for this cat picture.

I had to use a terrible iOS editor to get my current one (avatar), so it's low-res. I'd like a flag, and it would be nice if it was like my current profile picture. A flag is what I mainly want, but a 250x250 avatar/profile picture would be great as well. Thanks!

EDIT: And I forgot the link, here it is.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B1mMx-QMmGbDankxMWROdGRVcWM

This may have been done already, but I would be interested in a set of mission flags for all the bodies in the Kerbol system.

It would be great if they were in a style similar to the various NASA mission patches (obviously Kerbalized).

This may have been done already, but I would be interested in a set of mission flags for all the bodies in the Kerbol system.

It would be great if they were in a style similar to the various NASA mission patches (obviously Kerbalized).

That'll be fun lol. If you look a few pages back, I made "national" flags for the inner (vanilla) planets so far, of course, they don't look like mission patches. got any real world models for us to match up to?

- - - Updated - - -

That would look great! I just want something different - I like to change it up every once in a while.

JR

I'm going to give you a couple font styles I'm thinking of using, let me know which ones you like.

There's a lot more out there, that's just a few I found from a quick google search for NASA mission patches. Since everyone's craft is different, maybe a generic design could be a Kerbal planting a flag (with the same picture on the flag in the flag) on the body the flag is intended for.

I really like this one. It looks so alien. Great job!

http://i.imgur.com/Imkm3Eg.jpg

Do one for the Freelance Community of Unaligned Kerbals.

JR

Edit: Sorry I didn't realize you wanted no text...

Hey JR, here's a list of fonts. What do you think?

post a picture

Ok, it'll take a while, but we might be able to do that.

Ok, it'll take a while, but we might be able to do that.

No rush, thanks for looking into it. I'm not planning to do another big career until 1.1.

I like the third one - I think it's the Star Trek one (or maybe TRON). I like the high tech look.

This may already have been done, but for some unaccountable reason I didn't feel like scrolling through over a hundred pages of posts in this thread alone...

I'm looking for a set of "flags" that are just block-text numbers against a contrasting background. I build lots of reusable infrastructure, and sometimes it's important for me to be able to distinguish quickly/easily between different copies of identical (or near-identical) craft. (Flying Dutchman 2 has all the Duna science on it that's coming home, but I docked it to Kerbin Orbital Transfer Station alongside Flying Dutchman 4 and Flying Dutchman 5 to await a Kerbin-to-orbit crew transport to take the returning crew and science home...but I lost track of which one was which and now all that tasty science is on its way to Eve hauling bulk LF/O to Eve Gas-n-Go-n-Orbital Science Lab! Aargh!)

I'm thinking black numbers against a white background, using the blocky numbers you find on sports team jerseys. (And then, with the World Cup mod, I can field my own Spaceball team too!)

This may already have been done, but for some unaccountable reason I didn't feel like scrolling through over a hundred pages of posts in this thread alone...

I'm looking for a set of "flags" that are just block-text numbers against a contrasting background. I build lots of reusable infrastructure, and sometimes it's important for me to be able to distinguish quickly/easily between different copies of identical (or near-identical) craft. (Flying Dutchman 2 has all the Duna science on it that's coming home, but I docked it to Kerbin Orbital Transfer Station alongside Flying Dutchman 4 and Flying Dutchman 5 to await a Kerbin-to-orbit crew transport to take the returning crew and science home...but I lost track of which one was which and now all that tasty science is on its way to Eve hauling bulk LF/O to Eve Gas-n-Go-n-Orbital Science Lab! Aargh!)

I'm thinking black numbers against a white background, using the blocky numbers you find on sports team jerseys. (And then, with the World Cup mod, I can field my own Spaceball team too!)

How many would you need? You could do this with paint. Do you not name your vessels with your numbering system?

I like the third one - I think it's the Star Trek one (or maybe TRON). I like the high tech look.

JR
